SENT.plain: An 83-year-old male was admitted with pulmonary tuberculosis
He was started on rifampicin, isoniazid, and streptomycin (SM)
The hematological data at 12 weeks after the treatment showed pancytopenia (RBC: 2.14 x 10(6)/microliters, Hb: 7.2g/dl, Plt: 1.8 x 10(4)/microliters, WBC: 700/microliters)
All the above medicines were discontinued and he received bolus methylprednisolone (bmPSL) and recombinant human granulocyte-colony stimulating factor (rhG-CSF)
After 3 cycles of bmPSL, red blood cells and platelets gradually increased
White blood cells also increased in response to rhG-CSF
Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy specimens showed normocellularity, indicating recovery from aplastic anemia
Drug lymphocyte stimulation test was positive for SM
